inference-rule (mathematical object)¶

Definition¶

An inference-rule is a syntactic transformation rule which allows to infer a valid statement from some premises.

Synonyms¶

  • Derivation rule

List of well-known inference-rules¶

  • absorption (inference-rule)

See also¶

  • Derivation rule

Bibliography¶

  • Derivation rule. Encyclopedia of Mathematics. URL: http://encyclopediaofmath.org/index.php?title=Derivation_rule&oldid=33737

  • List of rules of inference. Wikipedia.

  • URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_rules_of_inference
